definition: to rummage through/to turn everything over/to ransack
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time

sentences.english: I searched every corner of your frig but these are all I found.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的冰箱都翻遍了，就找到这些。

sentences.english: A clerk thumbed through the files looking for a letter.
sentences.chinese: 办事员翻遍了案卷，寻找一封信件。

sentences.english: They ransacked the whole classroom for their basketball.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻遍了整个教室寻找他们的篮球。

sentences.english: I rummaged all the drawers before I found my ballpoint pen.
sentences.chinese: 我翻遍了所有的抽屉才找到我的圆珠笔。

sentences.english: Susan hunted through her purse for some change.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊翻遍钱包找点零钱。

sentences.english: She foraged about in her handbag, but couldnt find her keys.
sentences.chinese: 她翻遍了手提包，就是找不到钥匙。

sentences.english: There are not words enough in the unabridged to describe it.
sentences.chinese: 翻遍了全本的词典也凑不够词来形容啊。

sentences.english: She ransacked the whole house for her keys.
sentences.chinese: 她翻遍了屋子来找钥匙。

sentences.english: Dave went through his pockets looking for the keys.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫翻遍了他的衣袋找钥匙。

sentences.english: You go through a lot of hangers.
John rummaged all the drawers to find his gloves。
sentences.chinese: 约翰为了寻找他的手套，翻遍了所有的抽屉。

sentences.english: The children turned the whole house topsy-turvy when their mother went out.
sentences.chinese: 当母亲不在家时，孩子们把屋里都翻遍了。

sentences.english: Having checked through my own photograph collection, I have enclosed a selection of orbs.
sentences.chinese: 我翻遍了自己的相册，选出几张带光点的附在下面。

sentences.english: None of my resource books had any useful selections.
sentences.chinese: 翻遍手头所有资料，没有找到任何合适的选段。

sentences.english: He went through his pockets looking for the key.
sentences.chinese: 他翻遍了自己所有的口袋找钥匙。

definition: to search everywhere/to search high and low/to comb
to go everywhere/to scour (the whole town)
to find (sth one has been looking for)
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
